intro: Stillingia trinervia, commonly known as the three-veined stillingia, is a flowering plant native to eastern Asia. It belongs to the family Papaveraceae, which includes poppies and other similar species. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves with three distinct veins. It produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the summer months. Stillingia trinervia is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
